nodes.bodyText: (optional) could you maybe remove this field? it looks redundant.
(optional) it would be nice if you could maybe document the purpose of this class. IIUC it allows Spark to interface with memstore, right?
So if there are no more rows, we consume the rowBuffer and return, otherwise, we consume the rowBuffer and pre-fetch the next row into rowBuffer, right?

Is this field necessary? could you please consider removing it, it makes understanding the code unnecessarily more complicated IMHO, i.e.:
make fetchNextAndGiveBuffer() return boolean indicating whether more rows are to come  (similar to RegionScanner.nextRaw) and assign it to a local variable in nextRaw call (maybe with some documentation)
That's not possible. The attribute would be read only the next time that nextRaw is being called, and that happens through some hbase code.
consider renaming this to something like: moreRowsFollow.

I think this is neither thread-safe nor exception-safe.
Instead maybe we should:

Moved the flushed flag into the updateScanner method and update it there with care.
Mark updateScanner method as synchronized.
It does not need to be thread safe, only one thread is using this scanner.
could you please rephrase the documentation.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -155,7 +191,7 @@ public boolean nextRaw(List<Cell> result) throws IOException {
      * refresh underlying RegionScanner we call this when new store file gets

nodes.bodyText: optional: add: assert htd != null && htd.getTableName() != null;
I don't understand this comment, does it mean that we have the full nextResult or could it be partial?

Typically, when we return from this function, we have managed to put the buffer in result and we've gotten a new buffer.
If we get a flush token, we cannot return the current buffer, because it may contain partial results. Those partial results would never be completed since nextRaw would return FLUSH.
So we need to return the flush before.
